meanings.definition: Refuse to acknowledge as one's own.
meanings.sent1: She disowned the old toy and gave it away.
meanings.sent2: He disowned his actions and blamed someone else.
meanings.sent3: The cat disowned the mouse toy and played with a ball instead.
meanings.sent4: The tree disowned its withered leaves, letting them fall to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The student disowned his mistake, pretending it was someone else's.

meanings.definition: Deny any connection with or responsibility for.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity disowned the controversial statement made by their manager.
meanings.sent2: She disowned her former friend after the betrayal.
meanings.sent3: The dog disowned the chewed-up shoe, looking innocent.
meanings.sent4: The politician disowned the unpopular policy, claiming it was a misunderstanding.
meanings.sent5: The company disowned the faulty product, offering refunds to customers.
